Description: Pour PDMS pre-polymer into a beaker and add PDMS curing agent at 10:1 ratio using a pipette.
Put disposable cup on the weighing scale and tare it. Pour the PDMS mixture in the cup and take note of the weight. Using the spoon, add 0.2 to 1% mass of MWCNT to the mixture.
Bring the cup of mixture to the fume hood, switch on the fume hood, and stir the mixture thoroughly using the stirrer.

Put the cup of well-stirred mixture in the vacuum oven, switch it on, turn off gas intake, switch on vacuum suction pump, and leave the cup of mixture there for 1 h. After which, switch off the vacuum suction pump and then the vacuum oven.
Bring the cup of mixture to the fume hood. Slowly and carefully pour the vacuumed mixture into Mould No. 1.
Put mould of mixture in the oven, switch it on, and configure temperature and period settings. After 2 h of heating, allow material to cool for 15 mins. After which, remove mould from oven.
Bring the mould of mixture to the work bench and remove the cured CNT-PDMS composite from the mould.
Dissolve Type I collagen in aqueous hydrochloric acid in the fume hood.
Homogenize the solution at 8000 rpm for 15 min using the homogenizer in the fume hood.
Place the cured CNT-PDMS composite in the hollow region of Mould No. 2, and carefully pour the collagen mixture into the mould cavity.
Put mould of mixture in the freeze drier, configure temperature and period settings, and leave it for 2 h.
Transfer the mould of mixture to the vacuum oven, configure temperature and period settings, and leave it for 12 h. After which, remove mould from oven.
Bring the mould of mixture to the work bench and remove the composite from the mould.
Spray the composite with 70% ethanol, and place the composite in the BSC. Close the glass door and switch on the UV light for 1 h to sterilize it.
Remove the cryopreserved epithelial cells from the cryopreservation system.
Thaw the cryopreserved epithelial cells in the water bath
Seed the thawed epithelial cells onto the composite using a pipette in the BSC.
Transfer the seeded composite to the bioreactor/incubator.
Allow the epithelial cells to grow and form a substantial amount of cilia.
